verses.verse: To the chief Musician,<WH5329> Maschil,<WH4905> for the sons<WH1121> of Korah.<WH7141> As the hart<WH354> panteth<WH6165> after<WH5921> the water<WH4325> brooks,<WH650> so<WH3651> panteth<WH6165> my soul<WH5315> after<WH413> thee, O God.<WH430>
My soul<WH5315> thirsteth<WH6770> for God,<WH430> for the living<WH2416> God:<WH410> when<WH4970> shall I come<WH935> and appear<WH7200> before<WH6440> God?<WH430>
My tears<WH1832> have been<WH1961> my meat<WH3899> day<WH3119> and night,<WH3915> while they continually<WH3605> <WH3117> say<WH559> unto<WH413> me, Where<WH346> is thy God?<WH430>

When I remember<WH2142> these<WH428> things, I pour out<WH8210> my soul<WH5315> in<WH5921> me: for<WH3588> I had gone<WH5674> with the multitude,<WH5519> I went<WH1718> with them to<WH5704> the house<WH1004> of God,<WH430> with the voice<WH6963> of joy<WH7440> and praise,<WH8426> with a multitude<WH1995> that kept holyday.<WH2287>

Why <WH4100> art thou cast down,<WH7817> O my soul?<WH5315> and why art thou disquieted<WH1993> in<WH5921> me? hope<WH3176> thou in God:<WH430> for<WH3588> I shall yet<WH5750> praise<WH3034> him for the help<WH3444> of his countenance.<WH6440>

O my God,<WH430> my soul<WH5315> is cast down<WH7817> within<WH5921> me: therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> will I remember<WH2142> thee from the land<WH4480> <WH776> of Jordan,<WH3383> and of the Hermonites,<WH2769> from the hill<WH4480> <WH2022> Mizar.<WH4706>
Deep <WH8415> calleth<WH7121> unto<WH413> deep<WH8415> at the noise<WH6963> of thy waterspouts:<WH6794> all<WH3605> thy waves<WH4867> and thy billows<WH1530> are gone<WH5674> over<WH5921> me.

Yet the LORD<WH3068> will command<WH6680> his lovingkindness<WH2617> in the daytime,<WH3119> and in the night<WH3915> his song<WH7892> shall be with<WH5973> me, and my prayer<WH8605> unto the God<WH410> of my life.<WH2416>
I will say<WH559> unto God<WH410> my rock,<WH5553> Why<WH4100> hast thou forgotten<WH7911> me? why<WH4100> go<WH1980> I mourning<WH6937> because of the oppression<WH3906> of the enemy?<WH341>
As with a sword<WH7524> in my bones,<WH6106> mine enemies<WH6887> reproach<WH2778> me; while they say<WH559> daily<WH3605> <WH3117> unto<WH413> me, Where<WH346> is thy God?<WH430>

Why <WH4100> art thou cast down,<WH7817> O my soul?<WH5315> and why<WH4100> art thou disquieted<WH1993> within<WH5921> me? hope<WH3176> thou in God:<WH430> for<WH3588> I shall yet<WH5750> praise<WH3034> him, who is the health<WH3444> of my countenance,<WH6440> and my God.<WH430>
